kiAutoAgent.backend.url.markdownDescription:
üêç **Python Backend URL**
- Default: `localhost:8001` (v5.0.0 LangGraph)
- The KI AutoAgent Python backend server with LangGraph integration
- All AI intelligence runs here

kiAutoAgent.backend.autoStart.markdownDescription:
üöÄ **Auto-Start Backend**
- Automatically start Python backend on extension activation
- Requires Python 3.8+ and backend dependencies installed

kiAutoAgent.backend.pythonPath.markdownDescription:
üêç **Python Executable Path**
- Path to Python executable
- Default: `python3` (uses system Python)
- Can be absolute path or command in PATH

kiAutoAgent.backend.timeout.markdownDescription:
‚è±Ô∏è **Backend Request Timeout (seconds)**
- How long to wait for backend responses
- Default: 180s (3 minutes) for complex tasks
- Increase for infrastructure analysis or large codebases

enumDescriptions: Optimized GPT-4 - Best for architecture and system design
Fast GPT-5 Mini - Lightweight but capable
Lightweight GPT-4 - Fast and cost-effective
kiAutoAgent.models.openai.architect.markdownDescription:
üèóÔ∏è **Model for ArchitectAgent**
- System design and architecture
- Infrastructure analysis

enumDescriptions: GPT-4o (Nov 2024) - Balanced performance, multimodal (2.5/10 $/M) ‚≠ê Recommended
ChatGPT-4o Latest - Always newest version, best features (5/15 $/M)
o1 Preview - Advanced reasoning, slower but best for complex logic (15/60 $/M)
o1 Mini - Fast reasoning, cost-effective for problem solving (3/12 $/M)
GPT-4o Mini - Very fast, budget-friendly for simple tasks (0.15/0.6 $/M)
GPT-5 Mini (2025) - Next-gen fast model, future-proof (0.2/0.8 $/M)
kiAutoAgent.models.openai.orchestrator.markdownDescription:
üéØ **Model for Orchestrator Agent**

**Current:** GPT-4o (November 2024)

**Use For:**
- Task decomposition & routing
- Multi-agent coordination
- Workflow planning

**üëç Why GPT-4o?**
- Excellent at breaking down complex tasks
- Fast response times
- Good cost/performance balance
- 128K context window

**üîÑ Alternatives:**
- `o1-preview` ‚Üí Best reasoning for very complex workflows (slower, expensive)
- `gpt-4o-mini` ‚Üí Fast & cheap for simple routing
- `chatgpt-4o-latest` ‚Üí Always newest features

**üí° Tip:** Use `KI AutoAgent: Configure Agent Models` to see all 15 GPT models with pros/cons/cost info.

enumDescriptions: Optimized GPT-4 - Best for comprehensive documentation
Fast GPT-5 Mini - Lightweight but capable
Lightweight GPT-4 - Fast and cost-effective
kiAutoAgent.models.openai.docubot.markdownDescription:
üìù **Model for DocuBot**
- Documentation generation
- API documentation

enumDescriptions: Fast GPT-5 Mini - Optimized for code review and validation
Lightweight GPT-4 - Fast and cost-effective for reviews
Optimized GPT-4 - More thorough but slower reviews

üîç **Model for ReviewerGPT**

enumDescriptions: Optimized GPT-4 - Best for performance analysis and optimization

enumDescriptions: Claude Sonnet 4.1 - Best for coding, fast, balanced (3/15 $/M) ‚≠ê Recommended
Claude Opus 4.1 - Supreme quality, best reasoning (15/75 $/M)
Claude 3.7 Sonnet - Extended thinking, cost-effective (3/15 $/M)
Claude 3.5 Haiku - Very fast, simple tasks (0.8/4 $/M)
Claude 3 Opus Legacy - Proven reliability, older (15/75 $/M)
kiAutoAgent.models.anthropic.codesmith.markdownDescription:
üíª **Model for CodeSmith Agent**

**Current:** Claude Sonnet 4.1

**Use For:**
- Code generation & implementation
- Bug fixing & refactoring
- Complex algorithms
- Full-stack development

**üëç Why Sonnet 4.1?**
- Excellent at coding tasks
- Fast response times
- 200K context window
- Best cost/performance for coding

**üîÑ Alternatives:**
- `claude-opus-4-1` ‚Üí Supreme quality for critical code (slower, 5x cost)
- `claude-3-5-haiku` ‚Üí Very fast for simple implementations
- `claude-3-7-sonnet` ‚Üí Extended thinking for complex logic

**üí° Tip:** Use `KI AutoAgent: Configure Agent Models` to see all 5 Claude models with detailed pros/cons.

enumDescriptions: Claude Sonnet 4.1 - Latest and most capable debugging model
Supreme Claude Opus 4.1 - Ultimate reasoning for complex bugs
Claude 3.7 Sonnet - Stable and reliable bug fixing

kiAutoAgent.models.autoDiscover.markdownDescription:
üîç **Auto-Discover AI Models on Startup**

Automatically queries provider APIs for available models with detailed information:

**üìä What's Discovered:**
- ‚úÖ **15 GPT models** including Realtime, o1 reasoning models
- ‚úÖ **5 Claude models** (Opus 4.1, Sonnet 4.1, Haiku)
- ‚úÖ **5 Perplexity models** (Sonar variants for research)

**üìù Rich Information:**
- Pros & Cons for each model
- Cost per million tokens ($/M)
- Best use cases
- Performance tier (Premium, Fast, Budget)

**üí° Commands:**
- `KI AutoAgent: Refresh Models` - Manual refresh
- `KI AutoAgent: Configure Agent Models` - Per-agent selection
- `KI AutoAgent: Select OpenAI/Anthropic/Perplexity Model` - Browse all models

**‚öôÔ∏è Tip:** Disable this if you prefer manual model configuration or have API rate limits.

kiAutoAgent.agents.configuration.markdownDescription:
ü§ñ **Agent Configuration Overview**

üìö Each agent has specialized instructions and models:

**üé≠ Workflow Coordination**
‚Ä¢ `OrchestratorAgent` ‚Üí [orchestrator.md](file://./instructionsets/orchestrator.md)
‚Ä¢ Model: GPT-4o
‚Ä¢ Handles: Multi-agent workflows, task routing

**‚öñÔ∏è Conflict Resolution**
‚Ä¢ `OpusArbitratorAgent` ‚Üí [richter.md](file://./instructionsets/richter.md)
‚Ä¢ Model: Claude Opus 4.1
‚Ä¢ Handles: Agent conflicts, final decisions

**üèóÔ∏è Architecture & Design**
‚Ä¢ `ArchitectAgent` ‚Üí [architect.md](file://./instructionsets/architect.md)
‚Ä¢ Model: GPT-4o
‚Ä¢ Handles: System design, patterns, scalability

**üíª Code Implementation**
‚Ä¢ `CodeSmithAgent` ‚Üí [codesmith.md](file://./instructionsets/codesmith.md)
‚Ä¢ Model: Claude Sonnet 4
‚Ä¢ Handles: Coding, testing, optimization

**üìà Trading Strategies**
‚Ä¢ `TradeStratAgent` ‚Üí [tradestrat.md](file://./instructionsets/tradestrat.md)
‚Ä¢ Model: Claude Sonnet 4
‚Ä¢ Handles: Trading algorithms, backtesting

**üîç Web Research**
‚Ä¢ `ResearchAgent` ‚Üí [research.md](file://./instructionsets/research.md)
‚Ä¢ Model: Perplexity Sonar
‚Ä¢ Handles: Web search, documentation

üéØ **Intent Detection Mode** ‚ö†Ô∏è [ORPHANED - NOT CONNECTED]
‚Ä¢ **strict**: Favors classifying as tasks (less queries)
‚Ä¢ **balanced**: Standard detection logic
‚Ä¢ **relaxed**: Favors classifying as queries (less tasks)

kiAutoAgent.intentDetection.queryKeyword.markdownDescription:
‚ùì **Query Keywords** ‚ö†Ô∏è [ORPHANED - NOT CONNECTED]
Keywords that indicate the request is likely a question/query

kiAutoAgent.intentDetection.taskKeywords.markdownDescription:

üöÄ **Prefer Task Execution** ‚ö†Ô∏è [ORPHANED - NOT CONNECTED]

kiAutoAgent.intentDetection.confidenceTh.markdownDescription:
üìä **Confidence Threshold** ‚ö†Ô∏è [ORPHANED - NOT CONNECTED]

kiAutoAgent.intentDetection.useAIClassif.markdownDescription:
ü§ñ **Use AI Classification** ‚ö†Ô∏è [ORPHANED - NOT CONNECTED]
Enhance keyword-based detection with AI when confidence is low

kiAutoAgent.intentDetection.debugLogging.markdownDescription:
üêõ **Debug Logging** ‚ö†Ô∏è [ORPHANED - NOT CONNECTED]

kiAutoAgent.ai.intentClassification.enab.markdownDescription:
üß† **Enable AI Intent Classification** ‚ö†Ô∏è [ORPHANED - NOT CONNECTED]
Use advanced AI-based intent classification instead of keywords

kiAutoAgent.ai.intentClassification.prov.markdownDescription:
ü§ñ **AI Provider** ‚ö†Ô∏è [ORPHANED - NOT CONNECTED]
Which AI model to use for intent classification
‚Ä¢ **auto**: Automatically select best available
‚Ä¢ **gpt-4**: Use OpenAI GPT-4
‚Ä¢ **claude**: Use Anthropic Claude

kiAutoAgent.ai.intentClassification.conf.markdownDescription:
üìä **AI Confidence Threshold** ‚ö†Ô∏è [ORPHANED - NOT CONNECTED]
Minimum confidence (0.3-0.95) for automatic execution
‚Ä¢ <0.6: Always ask for clarification
‚Ä¢ 0.6-0.8: May ask for confirmation
‚Ä¢ >0.8: Execute without confirmation

kiAutoAgent.ai.intentClassification.requ.markdownDescription:
‚úÖ **Require Explicit Confirmation** ‚ö†Ô∏è [ORPHANED - NOT CONNECTED]
Always ask for confirmation even with high confidence

kiAutoAgent.ai.intentClassification.lear.markdownDescription:
üìö **Learn from Corrections** ‚ö†Ô∏è [ORPHANED - NOT CONNECTED]
Improve classification accuracy by learning from user corrections

kiAutoAgent.ai.intentClassification.mult.markdownDescription:
ü§ù **Multi-Model Consensus** ‚ö†Ô∏è [ORPHANED - NOT CONNECTED]
Use multiple AI models for critical decisions (slower but more accurate)

kiAutoAgent.ai.intentClassification.dete.markdownDescription:
üòè **Detect Sarcasm** ‚ö†Ô∏è [ORPHANED - NOT CONNECTED]
Detect and handle sarcastic responses appropriately

kiAutoAgent.ai.intentClassification.open.markdownDescription:

‚è±Ô∏è **Cache Duration (seconds)** ‚ö†Ô∏è [ORPHANED - NOT CONNECTED]
How long to cache classification results (0 to disable)

üíæ **Auto Save** ‚ö†Ô∏è [ORPHANED - NOT CONNECTED]
Automatically save conversation history

üì¶ **Compact Mode** ‚ö†Ô∏è [ORPHANED - NOT CONNECTED]
Start chat in compact message view

kiAutoAgent.validationWorkflow.enabled.markdownDescription:
üîç **Enable Validation Workflow** ‚ö†Ô∏è [ORPHANED - NOT CONNECTED]
Automatically validate implementations with ReviewerGPT after each task

kiAutoAgent.validationWorkflow.maxIterat.markdownDescription:
üîÑ **Max Validation Iterations** ‚ö†Ô∏è [ORPHANED - NOT CONNECTED]
Maximum number of validation/fix cycles to perform

kiAutoAgent.validationWorkflow.agents.markdownDescription:
üë• **Validation Agents** ‚ö†Ô∏è [ORPHANED - NOT CONNECTED]
Agents to use in the validation workflow

kiAutoAgent.validationWorkflow.autoFix.markdownDescription:
üîß **Auto-Fix Issues** ‚ö†Ô∏è [ORPHANED - NOT CONNECTED]
Automatically attempt to fix issues found during validation with FixerBot

kiAutoAgent.langgraph.enabled.markdownDescription:
üîÄ **Enable LangGraph Workflow Engine**

Controls the v5.0 LangGraph-based multi-agent workflow system:

**‚úÖ Enabled (default):**
- Advanced state management
- Agent-to-agent communication
- Automatic checkpointing
- Workflow visualization

**‚ùå Disabled:**
- Falls back to simple agent calls
- No state persistence
- Limited error recovery

**üí° Recommended:** Keep enabled for production workflows

kiAutoAgent.langgraph.checkpointInterval.markdownDescription:
üíæ **LangGraph Checkpoint Interval**

How often to save workflow state (in agent steps):

- **1**: Save after every agent call (safest, slower)
- **5**: Balance between safety and speed ‚≠ê Recommended
- **10+**: Faster but risk losing progress on crash

**Use Cases:**
- Critical tasks: 1-3
- Normal development: 5-7
- Fast iterations: 10+

kiAutoAgent.langgraph.maxIterations.markdownDescription:
üîÑ **Max LangGraph Workflow Iterations**

Maximum number of agent steps before stopping:

**Prevents infinite loops in workflows**

- **5-10**: Simple tasks (code review, documentation)
- **20**: Complex tasks (architecture, refactoring) ‚≠ê Recommended
- **50+**: Very complex multi-agent workflows

**‚ö†Ô∏è Warning:** Higher values = more API cost

kiAutoAgent.langgraph.parallelExecution.markdownDescription:
‚ö° **Enable Parallel Agent Execution**

Allow multiple agents to work simultaneously:

**‚úÖ Enabled:**
- 2-3x faster for independent tasks
- Higher API rate limit usage
- More complex error handling

**‚ùå Disabled (recommended):**
- Sequential agent execution
- Easier to debug
- Lower API costs

**üí° Tip:** Enable for large codebases or urgent tasks

kiAutoAgent.langgraph.stateManagement.markdownDescription:
üóÑÔ∏è **LangGraph State Storage Backend**

How to persist workflow state:

- **memory**: Fast but lost on restart (testing only)
- **sqlite**: Persistent, good performance ‚≠ê Recommended
- **checkpoint**: Full workflow snapshots (slower, safe)

**Recommendation:** sqlite for production, memory for testing
enumDescriptions: In-Memory - Fast but volatile
SQLite Database - Persistent and balanced ‚≠ê
Checkpoint Files - Maximum safety, slower

kiAutoAgent.agents.qualityThreshold.markdownDescription:
‚≠ê **Agent Quality Threshold**

Minimum quality score (0.5-0.95) to accept agent output:

**Score Ranges:**
- **0.5-0.6**: Accept most outputs (fast, may have issues)
- **0.7-0.8**: Balanced quality ‚≠ê Recommended
- **0.85-0.95**: Very strict (slower, expensive, best quality)

**How it works:**
1. Agent produces output
2. Reviewer scores quality (0-1)
3. If < threshold ‚Üí Send to Fixer
4. Repeat until quality met or max iterations

**üí° Tip:** Lower for prototyping, raise for production

kiAutoAgent.agents.maxRetries.markdownDescription:
üîÑ **Max Agent Retries**

How many times to retry an agent on failure:

- **1**: Fail fast (good for testing)
- **3**: Standard retries ‚≠ê Recommended
- **5+**: Persistent retry (expensive)

**Retry Triggers:**
- API rate limits
- Timeout errors
- Quality below threshold
- Agent exceptions

**‚ö†Ô∏è Cost Impact:** Each retry = additional API call

kiAutoAgent.agents.reviewerIterations.markdownDescription:
üîç **Reviewer Iteration Cycles**

How many review passes before accepting code:

- **1**: Single review (fast, may miss issues)
- **2**: Double review ‚≠ê Recommended
- **3+**: Thorough review (slower, expensive)

**Workflow:**
1. CodeSmith implements
2. Reviewer checks (iteration 1)
3. If issues ‚Üí Fixer fixes
4. Reviewer checks again (iteration 2)
5. Accept or repeat

**üí° Tip:** Use 3+ for critical production code

kiAutoAgent.agents.fixerIterations.markdownDescription:
üîß **Fixer Iteration Attempts**

How many times Fixer can attempt to fix issues:

- **1**: One fix attempt (fast)
- **3**: Multiple fix attempts ‚≠ê Recommended
- **5**: Maximum fix persistence (expensive)

**Escalation Path:**
1. Fixer attempts fix (iteration 1-3)
2. Reviewer validates each fix
3. If all iterations fail ‚Üí Escalate to OpusArbitrator

**‚ö†Ô∏è Cost:** Each iteration = CodeSmith + Reviewer + Fixer calls

kiAutoAgent.alternativeFixer.enabled.markdownDescription:
ü§ñüîÑ **Alternative Fixer AI (v5.1.0)**

Try different AI model when primary fixer (Claude) fails:

**Why this works:**
- Different AI = different "mental model"
- Fresh neural network = fresh perspective
- Like asking a different developer

**When triggered:**
- After primary fixer fails multiple times
- After information gathering attempts
- Before asking user/OpusArbitrator

**Models available:**
- GPT-4o (fast, different approach)
- GPT-5 (most capable, if available)
- Claude Opus 4 (highest authority)

**üí° Tip:** Enable for higher success rate (+10-15%)

kiAutoAgent.alternativeFixer.model.markdownDescription:
ü§ñ **Alternative Fixer AI Model**

Which AI to use as alternative fixer:

**Recommended:**

- **gpt-4o**: Fast, capable, different from Claude ‚≠ê
  - Speed: Very fast
  - Cost: Moderate
  - Best for: Most cases

- **gpt-5**: Latest GPT (if available)
  - Speed: Fast
  - Cost: Higher
  - Best for: Complex bugs

**Budget:**

- **gpt-5-mini**: Cheaper alternative
  - Speed: Fastest
  - Cost: Low
  - Best for: Simple fixes

**Not recommended:**

- **claude-sonnet-4**: Same as primary fixer (no benefit!)
- **claude-opus-4**: Save for OpusArbitrator level

**üí° Current:** GPT-4o gives best balance
enumDescriptions: GPT-4o - Fast and capable ‚≠ê
GPT-5 - Latest GPT model
GPT-5-mini - Faster, budget option
Claude Opus 4 - Highest authority (better for OpusArbitrator)
Claude Sonnet 4 - Primary fixer (circular, not useful!)

kiAutoAgent.alternativeFixer.triggerAfte.markdownDescription:
üî¢ **Alternative Fixer Trigger Point**

After how many collaboration iterations to try alternative AI:

**Timeline:**
- **Iterations 1-4**: Normal Fixer attempts
- **Iterations 5-6**: Broad information gathering
- **Iterations 7-8**: Targeted research
- **Iterations 9-10**: Alternative approach
- **Iteration 11**: Alternative Fixer KI ‚≠ê

**Lower (5-8):**
- Pros: Faster escalation to alternative AI
- Cons: Less information gathered first

**Higher (12-15):**
- Pros: More information before alternative AI
- Cons: More time/cost before trying

**üí° Recommended:** 11 (after all research levels)

kiAutoAgent.alternativeFixer.temperature.markdownDescription:
üå°Ô∏è **Alternative Fixer Creativity**

Temperature for alternative fixer AI:

**Lower (0.0-0.5):**
- More deterministic and consistent
- Follows patterns closely
- Best for: Syntax errors, known bugs

**Medium (0.6-0.8):** ‚≠ê Recommended
- Balance of consistency + creativity
- Can try different approaches
- Best for: Most bugs

**Higher (0.9-1.0):**
- More creative and exploratory
- May try unconventional solutions
- Best for: Stuck on unusual bugs

**üí° Tip:** 0.7 gives good balance for fresh perspective

kiAutoAgent.routing.strategy.markdownDescription:
üéØ **Agent Routing Strategy**

How to select which agent handles a task:

**Options:**

- **keyword**: Fast pattern matching (90% accuracy)
  - Pros: Very fast, predictable, low cost
  - Cons: Can miss edge cases
  - Best for: Clear, well-defined tasks

- **confidence**: AI-based semantic routing (95% accuracy)
  - Pros: Handles ambiguous requests
  - Cons: Slower, costs 1 API call per routing
  - Best for: Complex or unclear requests

- **hybrid**: Keyword + confidence fallback ‚≠ê Recommended
  - Pros: Fast + accurate, best of both worlds
  - Cons: Slightly more complex logic
  - Best for: Production use

**üí° Current v5.0:** Hybrid system with priority keywords
enumDescriptions: Keyword Matching - Fast pattern-based routing
Confidence Scoring - AI-based semantic routing
Hybrid Approach - Keywords + confidence fallback ‚≠ê

kiAutoAgent.routing.confidenceThreshold.markdownDescription:
üìä **Routing Confidence Threshold**

Minimum confidence (0.5-0.95) to auto-route to an agent:

**Confidence Levels:**
- **< 0.6**: Ask user to clarify
- **0.6-0.7**: Suggest agent, ask confirmation
- **0.8-0.9**: Auto-route with notification ‚≠ê Recommended
- **> 0.9**: Silent auto-routing

**Example:**
- "fix this bug" ‚Üí 0.95 confidence ‚Üí FixerBot (auto)
- "improve code" ‚Üí 0.65 confidence ‚Üí Ask: FixerBot or Performance?
- "do something" ‚Üí 0.3 confidence ‚Üí Ask user to clarify

**üí° Tip:** Lower = more user interaction, Higher = more automation

kiAutoAgent.routing.fallbackAgent.markdownDescription:
üîÄ **Fallback Agent When Routing Fails**

Which agent to use when routing confidence is too low:

- **orchestrator**: Let orchestrator decide ‚≠ê Recommended
  - Pros: Intelligent decomposition
  - Cons: Extra API call

- **codesmith**: Default to CodeSmith
  - Pros: Fast, direct
  - Cons: May not be optimal choice

- **ask-user**: Show agent picker
  - Pros: User in control
  - Cons: Interrupts workflow

**üí° Recommended:** orchestrator for production
enumDescriptions: Orchestrator - Let orchestrator decompose task ‚≠ê
CodeSmith - Default implementation agent
Ask User - Show agent selection dialog

kiAutoAgent.routing.enableKeywordMatchin.markdownDescription:
üî§ **Enable Keyword-Based Routing**

Use fast keyword matching for agent selection:

**‚úÖ Enabled (recommended):**
- 10x faster than AI routing
- 90% accuracy for clear requests
- No API cost for routing
- Priority system for ambiguous keywords

**‚ùå Disabled:**
- Falls back to confidence scoring
- Slower but more accurate
- API cost for every routing decision

**üí° Current v5.0:** Hybrid system - keywords first, then confidence if needed

kiAutoAgent.routing.enableSemanticMatchi.markdownDescription:
üß† **Enable Semantic Similarity Routing**

Use AI-based semantic matching as fallback:

**‚úÖ Enabled (recommended):**
- Handles ambiguous requests
- Better for natural language
- Costs 1 API call per uncertain routing

**‚ùå Disabled:**
- Falls back to `routing.fallbackAgent` setting
- Faster but less accurate
- No routing API costs

**üí° Works with:** `routing.strategy = hybrid` or `confidence`

kiAutoAgent.monitoring.enabled.markdownDescription:
üìä **Enable Performance Monitoring**

Track agent performance metrics:

**‚úÖ Enabled:**
- Agent execution times
- Routing success rates
- Quality scores
- API usage statistics
- Error rates per agent

**‚ùå Disabled:**
- Minimal overhead
- No performance data

**üí° View Stats:** `KI AutoAgent: Show Agent Performance`

kiAutoAgent.monitoring.logAgentMetrics.markdownDescription:
üìà **Log Agent Metrics to File**

Save detailed agent metrics to `.kiautoagent/metrics.json`:

**‚úÖ Enabled:**
- Persistent metrics history
- Analyze trends over time
- Debug performance issues
- ~1MB per 1000 requests

**‚ùå Disabled (recommended):**
- In-memory only
- Lower disk usage

**üí° Tip:** Enable for 1-2 weeks to analyze patterns, then disable

kiAutoAgent.monitoring.trackRoutingSucce.markdownDescription:
üéØ **Track Routing Success Rate**

Monitor how often agents are routed correctly:

**Metrics Tracked:**
- Keyword match success rate
- Confidence score distribution
- User corrections (when user picks different agent)
- Fallback frequency

**üí° View:** `KI AutoAgent: Show Agent Performance` ‚Üí Routing tab

kiAutoAgent.monitoring.alertOnFailures.markdownDescription:
üö® **Show Alerts on Agent Failures**

Display notifications when agents fail:

**‚úÖ Enabled (recommended):**
- Immediate failure notification
- Error details in popup
- Suggest retry or alternative agent

**‚ùå Disabled:**
- Silent failures
- Errors only in logs

**üí° Recommended:** Keep enabled during development

kiAutoAgent.context.maxTokensPerAgent.markdownDescription:
üìù **Max Context Tokens Per Agent**

Maximum tokens to send to each agent:

**Token Budgets:**
- **1000-2000**: Single file tasks
- **4000-8000**: Multi-file tasks ‚≠ê Recommended
- **16000-32000**: Large codebase analysis
- **64000-128000**: Entire project context (expensive!)

**‚ö†Ô∏è Cost Impact:**
- 8K tokens ‚âà $0.02-0.20 per request (varies by model)
- Higher = more context but exponentially higher cost

**üí° Tip:** Start with 8K, increase only if agent needs more context

kiAutoAgent.context.includeHistory.markdownDescription:
üí¨ **Include Chat History in Context**

Send previous conversation to agents:

**‚úÖ Enabled (recommended):**
- Agents remember previous context
- Better continuity
- Higher token usage

**‚ùå Disabled:**
- Each agent call is independent
- Lower token usage
- May lose context

**üí° Controlled by:** `context.historyDepth` setting

kiAutoAgent.context.historyDepth.markdownDescription:
üìö **Chat History Depth**

How many previous messages to include:

- **0**: No history (stateless agents)
- **5-10**: Recent context ‚≠ê Recommended
- **20-50**: Full conversation (expensive)

**Token Impact:**
- ~100-500 tokens per message
- 10 messages ‚âà 1K-5K tokens

**üí° Tip:** 10 messages = good balance between context and cost

kiAutoAgent.memory.enabled.markdownDescription:
üß† **Enable Long-Term Memory**

**‚ö†Ô∏è EXPERIMENTAL v5.0 Feature**

Allow agents to remember across sessions:

**‚úÖ Enabled:**
- Agents learn from past interactions
- Remember project patterns
- Improve over time
- Stored in `.kiautoagent/memory.db`

**‚ùå Disabled (recommended for now):**
- Stateless agents
- No cross-session memory

**üí° Status:** Currently experimental, use with caution

kiAutoAgent.memory.storageBackend.markdownDescription:
üóÑÔ∏è **Memory Storage Backend**

How to persist agent memory:

- **sqlite**: Fast, persistent, queryable ‚≠ê Recommended
- **json**: Simple files, easy to inspect
- **memory**: RAM only, lost on restart (testing)

**Storage Locations:**
- SQLite: `.kiautoagent/memory.db`
- JSON: `.kiautoagent/memory/*.json`
- Memory: No persistence

**üí° Tip:** sqlite for production, json for debugging
enumDescriptions: SQLite Database - Fast and persistent ‚≠ê
JSON Files - Easy to inspect and edit
In-Memory - Testing only, no persistence

kiAutoAgent.cost.trackUsage.markdownDescription:
üí∞ **Track API Usage & Costs**

Monitor API token usage and estimated costs:

**‚úÖ Enabled (recommended):**
- Real-time cost tracking
- Per-agent cost breakdown
- Monthly/daily summaries
- Budget alerts

**‚ùå Disabled:**
- No cost visibility

**üí° View:** `KI AutoAgent: Show Agent Performance` ‚Üí Costs tab

kiAutoAgent.cost.monthlyBudget.markdownDescription:
üíµ **Monthly Budget Limit (USD)**

Maximum monthly spend on API calls:

**Budget Ranges:**
- **$0**: Unlimited (no budget tracking)
- **$10-50**: Personal projects
- **$100-500**: Small team ‚≠ê Recommended
- **$1000+**: Enterprise usage

**What Happens at Limit:**
1. Warning at 80% usage
2. Confirmation required at 90%
3. Blocked at 100% (configurable)

**üí° Tip:** Set realistic budget, review monthly in performance stats

kiAutoAgent.cost.alertOnThreshold.markdownDescription:
üö® **Budget Alert Threshold**

Show warning when reaching % of monthly budget:

- **0.5** (50%): Early warning
- **0.8** (80%): Standard warning ‚≠ê Recommended
- **0.9** (90%): Late warning

**Alert Actions:**
- Notification with current spend
- Suggest switching to cheaper models
- Option to increase budget

**üí° Tip:** 0.8 gives time to adjust before hitting limit

kiAutoAgent.cost.preferCheaperModels.markdownDescription:
üí∏ **Prefer Cheaper Models When Possible**

Automatically use cost-effective models:

**‚úÖ Enabled:**
- Simple tasks ‚Üí Mini models (GPT-4o-mini, Haiku)
- Complex tasks ‚Üí Full models (GPT-4o, Sonnet)
- Can save 60-90% on API costs
- May reduce quality for edge cases

**‚ùå Disabled (recommended):**
- Always use configured models
- Consistent quality
- Higher costs

**üí° Tip:** Enable when approaching budget limit

scripts.build: npm run version:patch && npm run compile

2.1.2.description: Fix OpusArbitrator visibility and extension output display

2.1.3.description: Fix Command Palette visibility for KI AutoAgent Chat commands

2.2.2.description: Added extensive debugging code to troubleshoot agent response issues

2.2.3.description: Fixed workflow to use only existing agents - mapped missing reviewer/fixer/docu agents to codesmith

2.3.0.description: MAJOR: Enhanced Agent Configuration System - Per-agent model selection, file-based instructions, self-adapting agents, auto-learning capabilities

2.3.1.description: HOTFIX: Fixed agent registration issues and double chat entries - agents now respond correctly

2.3.2.description: DEBUG: Added extensive debug logging system to identify agent registration and chat mode issues
